author: anoxie
post: Basically i meant you don’t know how the 3d is encoded on the shroud, you are assuming “facts”. If you use the vp8, you can see “3d”, it does’t mean you.ve deciphered the way cloth body distance is encoded. You write : a “depth map” has nothing to do with isotropy Once again, you create an artificial depth map to generate your anaglyph. To do so you use an horizontal shift (stereoscopic vision required by the anaglyph) but contrary to the example of this post (the two mona lisa) you don’t know under which perspective you should look at the shroud (left right, oblique, upside down). You write : the parameter needed is not essential, nor unique Well, to create a subjective 3d vision. To put science in a “depth map” one has to have a scientific model. I’m right, not asking, not dogmatic..
title: Did Leonardo da Vinci Accidentally Invent 3D Pictures
